page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content:
Most of the 27 householders of Snelland own one or more cars. Those without cars are served by one service bus a week, presently on a Friday, into and out of Lincoln. There is also one free bus a week run by one of the large supermarket chains.
The railway station at Snelland was closed 18 years ago. Until then the children travelled by train to Lincoln or Market Rasen to attend school. There is bus transport to Faldingworth Junior School (3 miles) and to De Aston Comprehensive School, Market Rasen (8 miles).
Bicycles are used by many inhabitants to get to neighbouring villages such as Langworth which has a Post Office, bakery and general stores.
